title: Album Page, Door with Dragon, Château de Chambord, May 11, 1888
title_raw: Door with Dragon, Château de Chambord
medium: graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper left corner: (perpendicular to drawing) 32; lower right corner (perpendicular to drawing): 30; at top left edge: The relief of flames etc. is about 1 1/2 centimeter; perpendicular to drawing at left: section ... AB / scale full size; below drawing at left: Door Chateau du Chambord / May 11 1888 / 1/10 execution.
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding depicting a view of the front and back of a wooden door with a profile of one of its diamond-shaped panels in the center of the sheet.  At left and right are the back and front of the door, respectively.  The upper section of the door shows a recessed diamond frame on which is the serpentine figure of a dragon breathing fire and surrounded by small flames with a crown suspended in the air above its head.  On the front of the door, the dragon faces the right; on the reaf of the door, the dragon faces to the left.  the lower half of the front door has another diamond-shaped panel that mimicks the one above, and scattered within it are more small flame carvings.  Raised, lozenge-shaped panels dominate the lower half of the door at left.  One lozenge has been drawn and is crossed by a line AB.  This line is drawn again in the center of the sheet and is the molding profile of the lozenge carving.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, Door with Dragon, Château de Chambord, May 11, 1888;  Whitney Warren Jr. (American, 1864–1943); France; graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric; 24.9 x 32 cm (9 13/16 x 12 5/8 in.), irregular; Gift of Mrs. William Greenough; 1943-51-203
